faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about our private notary service

q1.question: Is your notarization officially recognized?
q1.answer: Yes. Our private notary is licensed and officially approved by the Abu Dhabi Judicial Department. All documents notarized through us carry the same legal validity as those issued by government notary centers.

q2.question: Can you visit my office or home?
q2.answer: Absolutely — this is our key advantage. We can come to you anywhere within Abu Dhabi (office, home, or even hospital) at a time that suits you to complete the process.

q3.question: How long does the notarization take?
q3.answer: Once the appointment is confirmed and the document draft is reviewed, notarization and signing are completed in the same session and you receive your notarized document immediately. The session usually takes no more than 15–30 minutes.

q4.question: What documents are required for notarization?
q4.answer: In general, a valid original Emirates ID is required for all signing parties, or a passport. Some special transactions (such as company contracts) may require additional documents, which will be clarified upon contact.
